thread.title: HS coach bans Saban, Alabama for 'not being ethical'
thread.title_full: HS coach bans Saban, Alabama for 'not being ethical'

title: HS coach bans Saban, Alabama for 'not being ethical'
text:
HS coach bans Saban, Alabama for 'not being ethical' "Everyone else is 100 percent welcome." Post to Facebook HS coach bans Saban, Alabama for 'not being ethical' "Everyone else is 100 percent welcome."  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/louisiana-high-school-coach-nick-saban-alabama-brandon-harris/   HS coach bans Saban, Alabama for 'not being ethical' Andrew Joseph 8:52 p.m. ET Feb. 15, 2017 
Alabama Crimson Tide head coach Nick Saban reacts during a post-game press conference after their loss to Clemson Tigers in the 2017 College Football Playoff National Championship Game at Raymond James Stadium. (Photo: Steve Mitchell-USA TODAY Sports) 
Nick Saban and his Alabama coaching staff may find themselves in an unfamiliar position if they want to recruit a player from Parkway (La.) High School. 
They won't be allowed on campus. 
In an interview with 104.5 ESPN in Baton Rouge, Parkway coach David Feaster said that the Crimson Tide coaches are no longer welcomed at the school's campus because they aren't "ethical." 
"LSU's welcome in my school anytime. The only school that can't come to Parkway is Alabama. And there's a long story behind that, but it had to do with not being ethical in their recruiting. 
"They can't come. Everyone else is 100 percent welcome." 
The reason was that former LSU quarterback Brandon Harris thought he had an offer from Alabama. It was not, apparently, a committable offer, and the Tide ultimately went in a different direction. According to Feaster, Harris wanted to commit to Alabama. 
Harris recently announced that he is transferring from LSU . Read or Share this story: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/louisiana-high-school-coach-nick-saban-alabama-brandon-harris/ Most Popular
